Content: OO4.4 - Be an effective supervisor, teacher and trainer of oculoplastic cases.
OO4.3 - Apply management and team working skills appropriately, including in complex, dynamic situations.
OO4.2 - Manage the complexity and uncertainty of oculoplastic cases.
OO4.1 - Demonstrate advanced clinical management and surgical skills.
CRS1 Consultation skills in oculoplastics
Independent management of the oculoplastics clinic
Management of thyroid eye disease
Participation in MDT meetings
Ability to supervise and train trainees and other health professionals in oculoplastics
OSATS Surgical skills - eyelid and adnexal surgery
OSATS Temporal artery biopsy
OSATS Removal of eye (enucleation and evisceration)
EPA L4 Managing an oculoplastics operating list
Surgical management of oculoplastic adnexal and lacrimal conditions including complex entropion
Anterior orbital biopsy
External dacryocystorhinostomy
Nasal endoscopy - either Outpatients or Theatre
Longitudinal observation by consultant assessor in the outpatient and/or on call setting
Longitudinal observation by consultant assessor in the theatre and simulation setting
Review of logbook
Review of personal audit of surgical outcomes
Review of record keeping and letters
CbDs
Multi-assessor report

Corneal grafting

C4.4 - Be an effective supervisor, teacher and trainer of cataract surgery.
C4.3 - Demonstrate team working and management skills, including in complex, dynamic situations.
C4.2 - Manage the complexity and uncertainty of cataract surgery cases.
C4.1 - Demonstrate advanced clinical management and surgical skills.
CRS1 Consultation skills in cataract surgery
Independent management of the cataract clinic
Perform and interpret biometry in complex cases

EPA L4 Managing a cataract operating list
Performance of anterior vitrectomy
Placement of secondary IOL
Management of complication including capsule tears and iris complications
Ability to supervise and train trainees in cataract surgery to Level 3 and other health professionals in a theatre setting
Longitudinal observation by consultant assessor in the outpatient and/or on call setting
Longitudinal observation by consultant assessor in the theatre and simulation setting
Review of logbook
Review of cataract refractive audit (to be completed within 3 years of L4 Cataract Surgery sign off)
Review of continuous complication log and ability to manage complications
Review of record keeping and letters

Multi-assessor report
